title: Ticket #1832: Interaction of STARTD_JOB_EXPRS and STARTD_ATTRS is undocumented
description:
If an attribute appears in both STARTD_JOB_EXPRS and STARTD_ATTRS, at the moment STARTD_JOB_EXPRS, so the job's ClassAd value stomps the configuration file's value. If the job's ClassAd lacks the attribute, the matching entry from the machine ClassAd is deleted. This behavior surprised at least one user (condor-admin 21457).

We should document this. Options I see:

  • Declare it undefined behavior and discourage it. Document it in the documentation for both STARTD_JOB_EXPRS and STARTD_ATTRS. Putting an attribute in both STARTD_JOB_EXPRS and STARTD_ATTRS seems pretty suspicious.
  • Declare it illegal, changing the code to report warnings or errors if it happens.
  • Declare it legal and document it in the documentation for both STARTD_JOB_EXPRS and STARTD_ATTRS.
